stems: put (someone or something) to the test

text: a set of questions or problems that are designed to measure a person's knowledge, skills, or abilities
{dx}see also {dxt|intelligence test||} {dxt|rorschach test||} {dxt|screen test||}{/dx}

examples.text: She is studying for her math/spelling/history *test*.
I passed/failed/flunked my biology *test*.
The teacher sat at his desk grading *tests*.
a driver's/driving *test*
an IQ *test*
*test* questions
The *test* will be on  the first three chapters of the book.
We {phrase}took/had a test{/phrase} on European capitals. = (*Brit*) We {phrase}did a test{/phrase} on European capitals.
The college relies on {phrase}test scores{/phrase} in its admissions process.

text: a careful study of a part of the body or of a substance taken from the body
{dx}see also {dxt|blood test||} {dxt|breath test||} {dxt|stress test||}{/dx}

examples.text: The *test* showed/revealed a problem with your liver function.
a vision/hearing *test*
a urine *test*
allergy *tests*
All applicants must pass a {phrase}drug test{/phrase}.
The doctor will call you with the {phrase}test results{/phrase}.
They went to the drug store to buy a {phrase}pregnancy test{/phrase}.
a {phrase}DNA test{/phrase}

text: a careful study of a small amount of water, soil, air, etc., in order to see if its quality is good, to find out if it contains a dangerous substance, etc.

examples.text: The *test* indicated high levels of lead in the soil.
routine water *tests*

text: a planned and usually controlled act or series of acts that is done to learn something, to see if something works properly, etc.
{dx}see also {dxt|road test||}{/dx}

examples.text: lab/laboratory *tests*
underground nuclear *tests*
a *test* of a new vaccine
{phrase}Taste tests{/phrase} revealed that people prefer this brand of cola over that one.

text: something (such as a difficult situation or task) that shows how strong or skilled someone or something is
{dx}see also {dxt|acid test||} {dxt|litmus test||}{/dx}

examples.text: a *test* of will/strength/character
The real/true *test* of your ability as a skier is whether you can ski well on very hard snow.

text: {sx|test match||}

definedRunOns.definedRunOnPhrase: put (someone or something) to the test

text: to cause (someone or something) to be in a situation that shows how strong, good, etc., that person or thing really is

examples.text: The team has been playing well so far, but tomorrow's game will really *put them to the test*.
A trip through the desert will *put* the truck *to the test*.
We decided to *put* the idea/theory *to the test*  with a little experiment.

text: to continue to be important, respected, etc., for a long period of time

examples.text: Great art/literature/music can *stand the test of time*.

text: {dx}see {dxt|character||}{/dx}

shortDefinitions: a set of questions or problems that are designed to measure a person's knowledge, skills, or abilities
a careful study of a part of the body or of a substance taken from the body
a careful study of a small amount of water, soil, air, etc., in order to see if its quality is good, to find out if it contains a dangerous substance, etc.

text: to use a set of questions or problems to measure someone's skills, knowledge, or abilities

examples.text: Weekly quizzes will *test* your understanding of the material.
The students will all be *tested* again at the end of the school year.

text: to examine a part of the body or a substance taken from the body

examples.text: The school nurse will be *testing* students' hearing next week.
The athletes knew that tournament officials would be *testing for* (the presence of) illegal drugs.
She {phrase}tested positive/negative{/phrase} *for* AIDS.

text: to examine a small amount of water, soil, air, etc., in order to see if its quality is good, if it contains a dangerous substance, etc.

examples.text: The water gets *tested* regularly.

text: to use (something) in a planned and usually controlled way in order to see if it works properly
{dx}see also {dxt|field-test||}{/dx}

examples.text: Only one of the vehicles they *tested* performed well in wet conditions.
Researchers are currently *testing* (the safety of) the vaccine.
The vaccine has not been *tested* on humans yet.
We designed a series of experiments to *test* our hypothesis.

text: to show how strong, good, etc., someone or something is in a difficult situation
{dx}see also {dxt|time-tested||}{/dx}

examples.text: The stress is *testing* the strength of our relationship.
The scandal is *testing* the country's faith in its leadership.
Life's ordeals *test* us.
You're *testing* my patience.

text: to do something to find out if people like or approve a possible plan, product, etc., so that you can make a decision about it

examples.text: The company is *testing the waters* with a new online version of the product.
She's *testing the waters* for a presidential bid.

shortDefinitions: to use a set of questions or problems to measure someone's skills, knowledge, or abilities —often + on
to examine a part of the body or a substance taken from the body —often + for
to examine a small amount of water, soil, air, etc., in order to see if its quality is good, if it contains a dangerous substance, etc. —often + for —+ for

text: an official agreement between countries with nuclear weapons to not test those weapons

examples.text: a nuclear *test ban* treaty

shortDefinitions: an official agreement between countries with nuclear weapons to not test those weapons

text: a legal case that will be used as an example when other similar cases are decided in the future

shortDefinitions: a legal case that will be used as an example when other similar cases are decided in the future

text: an occurrence in which you drive a car that you do not own to see if you like it and would like to buy it

examples.text: Would you like to take the car for a *test drive*?

shortDefinitions: an occurrence in which you drive a car that you do not own to see if you like it and would like to buy it

text: a game or series of games of cricket or rugby played by teams from different countries

shortDefinitions: a game or series of games of cricket or rugby played by teams from different countries

text: a pilot who flies new aircraft in order to see how well they work

shortDefinitions: a pilot who flies new aircraft in order to see how well they work

text: an occurrence in which a product or procedure is tried in order to see if it works correctly {sx|trial run||}

examples.text: They did a *test run* of the new software.

shortDefinitions: an occurrence in which a product or procedure is tried in order to see if it works correctly : trial run

text: a glass container that is shaped like a tube which is closed at one end and that is used especially in science experiments

shortDefinitions: a glass container that is shaped like a tube which is closed at one end and that is used especially in science experiments

text: a child produced from an egg that was fertilized outside of a woman's body and then put back into the woman's body to finish developing

shortDefinitions: a child produced from an egg that was fertilized outside of a woman's body and then put back into the woman's body to finish developing
